conclusion: Analyze the velocity-time graph to determine if the speed difference is continuously increasing.
The graph shows two curves, A and B, representing velocities over time. Both start from rest at t=0.
Curve A reaches a higher peak velocity compared to curve B.
The difference in speed is the vertical distance between the curves, starting at zero.
As time increases, object A's velocity increases more rapidly, increasing the speed difference.
After object A reaches its peak velocity, the speed difference starts to decrease.
The difference in speed is not continuously increasing; it increases then decreases.
Final answer: No, the difference in speed is not continuously increasing.
